 Welll your contention is simply wrong and its demonstrably wrong and its known to be wrong for many decades now. Cellular structures ARE determined by genes and upon mutation the structure and functions involved may be changed greatly. If you do not think so then consider that hemoglobin produced by the sickle cell trait mutation has a different structure and differing function from normal hemoglobin. Its well known that this change is a simple point mutation. I believe you have been informed of this small falsifying detail to your theory previousley but failed to take adequate note of it..
 
 You can consider your question answered. The hemoglobin molecule is as tightly coupled to the gene as one might hope. Change the gene change the hemoblobin. Hemoblobin is of course a key piece of cellular machinery in certain organisms.

And let us not forget that its very well documented that mutations in DNA do lead to new chemical structures which are part of the body of microbes. Any contention that new "parts" cannot be based on genes is doomed to failure on a simple empirical basis. so what if flagella parts are effected by a change of genes....so are fly wings. The challenge was to present me any evidence that mutations can actually create new raw material for selection.

 
 
 DO YOU ACTUALLY KNOW what precise role genes play in the construction of a body?

A single random mutation cannot create a new organ.

 
 Actually new organs are developed only by MODIFICATION of existing ones. But those modifications are due to chages in the existing physical and chemical structures. New chemical structures can however arise easily by mutation. For example mutation of a single base in chloroplast DNA results in effectively total resistance to the microbial peptide tentoxin. One can indeed turn it on and turn it off with a little genetic manipulation. In addition the specific mechanisms involved are well described in the literature. Glad to supply a set of links if anyone really wants to read them, but will not do so unless requested. CF1 I might add is one of the most important body parts to be found anywhere - most of our food supply depends on its turbine like function.

so what if flagella parts are effected by a change of genes?.
..
 
 Flagella are composed of proteins, all the proteins present are specified by genes which fix the primary structure of the proteins. The physicochemical interactions between the proteins are structurally dependent. Change the structure and you can and do change the functioning of the flagella. For example there are right rotating and left rotating flagella! Much like right and left handed nuts and bolts.
 
 And by the way there is no CREATION involved at all, just more and more detailed and well understood chemistry. Its not purposeful, its not intentional and it need be neither.

 Is it really easier to believe that some eternal all-powerful being decided to create life one day than it is to believe that life is a chemical and physical effect which can arise due to physical laws? The truth is evos can no more explain the existence of any structure than they can explain the beginning of life itself.

 No older fossils have been discovered thus these are the oldest examples of multicellular life.
